alert.note: Alert for Black Mesa Area; Chinle Valley; Chuska Mountains and Defiance Plateau; Eastern Mogollon Rim; Little Colorado River Valley in Apache County; Little Colorado River Valley in Coconino County; Little Colorado River Valley in Navajo County; Northeast Plateaus and Mesas Hwy 264 Northward; Northeast Plateaus and Mesas South of Hwy 264; Northern Gila County; Oak Creek and Sycamore Canyons; Western Mogollon Rim; White Mountains; Yavapai County Mountains (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued June 27 at 12:33PM MST until June 28 at 8:00PM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: ...Critical Fire Weather Conditions Continue... Critical fire weather conditions will continue to impact northern Arizona. The strongest winds are occurring today with sustained 20-30 mph winds with gusts 40-50 mph. Winds slack below critical limits for western Arizona Wednesday but remain elevated for areas near and along the Mogollon Rim to the Four Corners Region. RHs continue to remain mainly in the single digits. ...RED FLAG WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 PM MST /9 PM MDT/ THIS EVENING FOR MUCH OF NORTHERN ARIZONA... ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 11 AM MST /NOON MDT/ TO 8 PM MST /9 PM MDT/ WEDNESDAY DUE TO STRONG WINDS AND LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY FOR PARTS OF NORTHERN ARIZONA... The National Weather Service in Flagstaff has issued a Red Flag Warning due to strong winds and low relative humidity, which is in effect from 11 AM MST /noon MDT/ to 8 PM MST /9 PM MDT/ Wednesday. The Fire Weather Watch is no longer in effect. * AFFECTED AREA...Locations near Alpine, Buffalo Pass, Chinle, Dilkon, Eagar, Flagstaff, Forest Lakes, Ganado, Heber, Holbrook, Kayenta, Kykotsmovi, Payson, Pine, Pinetop- Lakeside, Prescott, Prescott Valley, Saint Johns, Sedona, Seligman, Shonto, Show Low, Snowflake, Tuba City, Whiteriver, Williams, Window Rock and Winslow. This includes portions of the Apache- Sitgreaves National Forest, Coconino National Forest, Kaibab National Forest, Prescott National Forest and Tonto National Forest. * WINDS...Southwest 20 to 30 mph with gusts up to 45 mph. * RELATIVE HUMIDITY...As low as 5 percent. * IMPACTS...The combination of gusty winds and low humidity can cause fire to rapidly grow in size and intensity before first responders can contain them.
info.instruction: A Red Flag Warning means that critical fire weather conditions are either occurring or are imminent. A combination of strong winds and low relative humidities can contribute to extreme fire behavior. Please notify field crews of this Red Flag Warning.
